Events that occurred on 17 July.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1912 - Author Barbara Strachey is born.
1918 - J.R.R. Tolkien attends a medical board examination in Kingston-upon-Hull.
1971 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 325.
1981 - The Tolkien Quiz Book, the book by Robinson and Wilson, is published.
1982 - The first episode of the new version of the 1981 radio series of The Lord of the Rings is aired on BBC Radio 4.
1985 - Robert Havard, Inkling, dies.
1998 - Author Paul H. Kocher dies.
1998 - Mythcon 29 in Wheaton, Illinois.
2004 - The Lord of the Rings Symphony in Seattle, Washington.
2009 - Mythcon 40 in Los Angeles, California.
2010 - Tolkien Thing 2010 in Bad Hersfeld, Germany.
2010 - Mythcon 41 in Dallas, Texas.
2011 - Tolkien Thing 2011 in Breuberg, Germany.
2011 - Mythcon 42 in Albuquerque, New Mexico.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
T.A. 3019:
New Moon[1]
